documentation.text:
@dev a mapping from transaction ID's to the sender address
 that initiates them. Owners can create several bTransactions
@dev a list of all transfers successful or unsuccessful

@dev Event to notify if transfer successful or failed
 after account approval verified

@dev add address of token to list of supported burnList using
 token symbol as identifier in mapping
@dev remove address of token we no more support

documentation.text:
@dev withdraw funds from this contract
 @param beneficiary address to receive ether

BurnSuccessful(address,address,uint256).details: Event to notify if transfer successful or failed after account approval verified

addNewBurnToken(bytes32,address,uint256).details: add address of token to list of supported burnList using token symbol as identifier in mapping

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeBurnToken(bytes32).details: remove address of token we no more support

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

bTransactionIndexesToSender.details: a mapping from transaction ID's to the sender address that initiates them. Owners can create several bTransactions

bTransactions.details: a list of all transfers successful or unsuccessful
